children.children: This mapping project was partially funded through an agreement with the U.S. Department of Agriculture, U.S. Forest Service, Northern Research Station. The Northern Research Station of the U.S. Forest Service seeks to improve people’s lives and help sustain the natural resources in the Northeast and Midwest through leading-edge science and effective information delivery. For more information, visit the Urban Waters Partnership site.
The City of Baltimore has more than 18,000 vacant lots that could be converted into uses that enhance neighborhoods and promote resiliency and sustainability.

In order to help neighborhood stakeholders identify greening strategies for these vacant lots, the City developed the Green Pattern Book that provides guidance on ways to achieve its vision of integrated green amenities.

There are 8 patterns within the Green Pattern Book. Mapping sites that show characteristics of the eight patterns is an essential tool for coordinating efforts and collectively achieving the vision defined by neighborhoods. In 2013, the Baltimore Neighborhood Indicators Alliance (BNIA-JFI) piloted a publicly- accessible, interactive map for this purpose using the pattern community-managed open space. Now, in 2014, BNIA-JFI is enhancing the map features and adding a second element for stormwater management. Future iterations of the map will include components of the remaining six green patterns.

Understanding how these sites impact urban waters and the communities that surrounds them requires ongoing information about the social, economic, and environmental characteristics of the City and the region. BNIA-JFI is leveraging existing socioeconomic data from the Vital Signs report and integrating it with data related to sites with potential to reduce runoff and nutrient loads to the City’s watersheds.

For each element of the Green Pattern Book, BNIA-JFI compiles data from a variety of primary sources and adds it to a spatial database that connects to Vital Signs community-based indicators, real property records, vacants to values properties, and adopt-a-lots. It is made accessible via a web-based interactive map.

Urban and suburban areas, including many of America’s post-industrial cities, grapple with how to manage abandoned and vacant properties When these properties are deconstructed or demolished, vacant lots lie in their wake. The Green Pattern Book, developed out of a grant from the US Foreast Service’s Northern Research Station to Baltimore City, is a tool to assist urban residents, administration, and community and nongovernmental organizations in "greening" these vacant lands and improving quality of life in the city. The book presents eight green project types for vacant lots, depending upon circumstances including community preferences, land tenure, and available funding, and provides extensive design guidelines around site selection, site layout and implementation, permits and zoning, maintenance, and funding. The Green Pattern Book is a robust tool for planning and implementing community greening initiatives throughout Baltimore, and is relevant to many other cities in America and beyond that are wrestling with problems stemming from vacant and abandoned properties. The Green Registry extends the relevance and impact of the Green Pattern Book, by providing a central repository for mapping past, current, and potential greening efforts. Most greening efforts are community-inspired, organized, and driven. We hope you will be inspired to think about a greening effort in your neighborhood, and that you use the Green Pattern Book and Green Registry as tools in your effort to help Baltimore achieve a greener future!

dictionaries.alias: Tree Plantings
dictionaries.layerdescription: Locations of tree plantings in Baltimore City.

dictionaries.alias: Forest Patches
dictionaries.layerdescription: Locations of forest patches in Baltimore City.

dictionaries.alias: Number of Event Permits Requested per 1,000 Residents
dictionaries.layerdescription: The number of event permits requested per 1,000 residents. Events include, but are not limited to, festivals, block parties, races, and parades. In the event of a large event, the central point is used to calculate the location of the request.

fields.name: artevnt15
fields.alias: Rate of Event Permits Requested per 1,000 Residents

dictionaries.alias: Number of Public Murals
dictionaries.layerdescription: The number of murals per CSA.

dictionaries.alias: Public Art per 1,000 Residents
dictionaries.layerdescription: The number of works of public art per 1,000 residents. These works include, but are not exclusive to, murals, monuments, sculptures, mosaics, and stained glass. The Baltimore Office of Promotion and the Arts tracks works created through the 1% for Public Art and Baltimore Mural Programs and maintains general inventories of public art and murals. Additional inventories of public art exist, but not at a comprehensive citywide scale and hence cannot be broken down into cross-neighborhood analyses.

dictionaries.alias: Total Population
dictionaries.layerdescription: Total number of persons living in a CSA.

dictionaries.alias: Percent of Residents - White/Caucasian
dictionaries.layerdescription: The total number of persons that identify themselves as being racially White (and ethnically non-Hispanic) out of the total number of persons living in an area.

dictionaries.alias: Percent of Residents - Hispanic
dictionaries.layerdescription: The total number of persons that identify their ethnicity as being Hispanic or Latino out of the total number of persons living in an area. Hispanic origin can be viewed as the heritage, nationality group, lineage, or country of birth of the person or the person

dictionaries.alias: Percent of Residents - Asian
dictionaries.layerdescription: The total number of persons that identify themselves as being Asian (and non-Hispanic) out of the total number of persons living in an area.

dictionaries.alias: Percent of Residents - Black/African-American
dictionaries.layerdescription: The total number of persons that identify themselves as being racially Black or African American (and ethnically non-Hispanic) out of the total number of persons living in an area.

dictionaries.alias: Racial Diversity Index
dictionaries.layerdescription: The percent chance that two people picked at random within an area will be of a different race/ethnicity. This number does not reflect which race/ethnicity is predominant within an area. The higher the value, the more racially and ethnically diverse an area.

dictionaries.alias: Median Household Income
dictionaries.layerdescription: The median household income is the middle value of the incomes earned in the prior year iby households within an area. Income and earnings are inflation-adjusted for the last year of the 5-year period. The median value is used as opposed to the average so that both extremely high and extremely low prices do not distort the total amount of income earned by households in an area.

dictionaries.alias: Percent of Children Living Below the Poverty Line
dictionaries.layerdescription: This indicator measures the percentage of persons under the age of 18 living in households where the total income fell below the poverty threshold out of all children in households in an area. Federal and state governments use such estimates to allocate funds to local communities. Local communities use these estimates to identify the number of individuals or families eligible for various programs.

fields.name: hhchpov15
fields.alias: Percent of Children Living Below the Poverty Line

dictionaries.alias: Percent of Family Households Living Below the Poverty Line
dictionaries.layerdescription: This indicator measures the percentage of households whose income fell below the poverty threshold out of all households in an area. Federal and state governments use such estimates to allocate funds to local communities. Local communities use these estimates to identify the number of individuals or families eligible for various programs.

fields.name: hhpov15
fields.alias: Percent of Family Households Living Below the Poverty Line

dictionaries.alias: Percent of Households Earning Less than $25,000
dictionaries.layerdescription: The percentage of households earning less than $25,000 out of all households in an area.

fields.name: hh25inc15
fields.alias: Percent of Households Earning Less than $25,000

dictionaries.alias: Percent of Households Earning $25,000 to $40,000
dictionaries.layerdescription: The percentage of households earning between $25,000 and $39,999 out of all households in an area.

dictionaries.alias: Percent of Households Earning $40,000 to $60,000
dictionaries.layerdescription: The percentage of households earning between $40,000 and $59,999 out of all households in an area.

dictionaries.alias: Percent of Households Earning $60,000 to $75,000
dictionaries.layerdescription: The percentage of households earning between $60,000 and $74,999 out of all households in an area.

dictionaries.alias: Percent of Households Earning More than $75,000
dictionaries.layerdescription: The percentage of households earning more than $75,000 out of all households in an area.

fields.name: hhm7515
fields.alias: Percent of Households Earning More than $75,000

dictionaries.alias: Percent of Female-Headed Households with Children Under 18
dictionaries.layerdescription: The percentage of female-headed households with children under 18 out of all households with children under 18 in an area.

fields.name: femhhs15
fields.alias: Percent of Female-Headed Households with Children Under 18

dictionaries.alias: Percent of Households with Children Under 18
dictionaries.layerdescription: The percentage of households with children living in the household that are under the age of 18 out of all households.

fields.name: fam15
fields.alias: Percent of Households with Children Under 18

dictionaries.alias: Percent of Population Under 5 years old
dictionaries.layerdescription: The percent of persons aged newborn to 5 years old out of all persons living in an area.

fields.name: age5_15
fields.alias: Percent of Population Under 5 Years Old

dictionaries.alias: Percent of Population 5-17 years old
dictionaries.layerdescription: The percent of persons aged 6 to 18 years old out of all persons living in an area.

dictionaries.alias: Percent of Population 18-24 years old
dictionaries.layerdescription: The percent of persons aged 19 to 24 years old out of all persons living in an area.

dictionaries.alias: Percent of Population 25-64 Years Old
dictionaries.layerdescription: The percent of persons aged 25 to 64 years old out of all persons living in an area.

dictionaries.alias: Percent of Population 65 years and over
dictionaries.layerdescription: The percent of persons over 65 years old out of all persons living in an area.

fields.name: age65_15
fields.alias: Percent of Population 65 years and over

dictionaries.alias: Part 1 Crime Rate per 1,000 Residents
dictionaries.layerdescription: The part 1 crime rate captures incidents of homicide, rape, aggravated assault, robbery, burglary, larceny, and auto theft that are reported to the Police Department. These incidents are per 1,000 residents in the neighborhood to allow for comparison across areas.

dictionaries.alias: Violent Crime Rate per 1,000 Residents
dictionaries.layerdescription: The violent crime rate measures the number of Part 1 crimes identified as being violent (homicide, rape, aggravated assault, and robbery) that are reported to the Police Department. These incidents are per 1,000 residents in the neighborhood to allow for comparison across areas.

dictionaries.alias: Property Crime Rate per 1,000 Residents
dictionaries.layerdescription: The property crime rate measures the number of Part 1 crimes identified as being property-based (burglary and auto theft) that are reported to the Police Department. These incidents are per 1,000 residents in the neighborhood to allow for comparison across areas.

dictionaries.alias: Number of Gun-Related Homicides per 1,000 Residents
dictionaries.layerdescription: The rate of homicides by firearm as reported in the Part 1 crime data per 1,000 residents in an area.

fields.name: gunhom15
fields.alias: Rate of Gun Homicides per 10,000 Residents

dictionaries.alias: Number of Shootings per 1,000 Residents
dictionaries.layerdescription: The rate of 911 calls for shootings per 1,000 residents in an area. Since the data comes from 911 calls, it is possible that multiple calls could be made for a single incident.

fields.name: shoot15
fields.alias: Rate of 911 Calls for Service for Shootings per 1,000 Residents

dictionaries.alias: Juvenile Arrest Rate per 1,000 Juveniles
dictionaries.layerdescription: The number of persons aged 10 to 17 arrested per 1,000 juveniles that live in an area. This indicator is calculated by where the arrested juvenile was arrested and not by where the crime is committed. Arrests are used instead of crimes committed since not all juveniles that are arrested are charged with committing a crime. This indicator also excludes offenders who are later charged as adults for their crime(s).

dictionaries.alias: Number of Narcotics Calls for Service per 1,000 Residents
dictionaries.layerdescription: The rate of calls for narcotics per 1,000 residents in an area. Since the data comes from 911 calls, it is possible that multiple calls could be made for a single incident.

fields.name: narc15
fields.alias: Rate of 911 Calls for Service for Narcotics per 1,000 Residents

dictionaries.alias: Number of Common Assault Calls for Service per 1,000 Residents
dictionaries.layerdescription: The rate of calls for assaults that do not involve a weapon per 1,000 residents in an area. Since the data comes from 911 calls, it is possible that multiple calls could be made for a single incident.

fields.name: caslt15
fields.alias: Rate of 911 Calls for Service for Common Assaults per 1,000 Residents

dictionaries.alias: Number of Adult Arrests per 1,000 Residents (Over the age of 18)
dictionaries.layerdescription: The number of persons aged 18 and over arrested per 1,000 adults that live in an area. This indicator is calculated by where the individual was arrested and not by where the crime is committed.

dictionaries.alias: Percentage of 3rd Grade Students who met or exceeded PARCC Reading
dictionaries.layerdescription: The percentages of students who met or exceeded PARCC exams in reading and mathematics in 3rd, 5th, and 8th grades. Partnership for Assessment of Readiness for College and Careers (PARCC) scores measure the number of students scoring in one of three classifications out of all students enrolled in that grade. Students can either be rated as exceeded, met, approached, partially met, or did not meet expectations of a subject. This indicator includes only those students who have tested as exceeded or met expectations.

fields.name: pread315
fields.alias: Percent of 3rd Grade Students who Met or Exceeded PARCC Reading Expectations

dictionaries.alias: Percentage of 3rd Grade Students who met or exceeded PARCC Math
dictionaries.layerdescription: The percentages of students who met or exceeded PARCC exams in reading and mathematics in 3rd, 5th, and 8th grades. Partnership for Assessment of Readiness for College and Careers (PARCC) scores measure the number of students scoring in one of three classifications out of all students enrolled in that grade. Students can either be rated as exceeded, met, approached, partially met, or did not meet expectations of a subject. This indicator includes only those students who have tested as exceeded or met expectations.

fields.name: pmath315
fields.alias: Percent of 3rd Grade Students who Met or Exceeded PARCC Math Expectations

dictionaries.alias: Percentage of Population aged 16-19 in School and/or Employed
dictionaries.layerdescription: The percentage of persons aged 16 to 19 who are in school and/or are employed out of all persons in their age cohort.

fields.name: sclemp15
fields.alias: Percent of Population Aged 16-19 in School and/or Employed

dictionaries.alias: Percent of Students Switching Schools within School Year
dictionaries.layerdescription: The percentage of 1st through 12th graders who change schools out of all students in a school year. Students must have attended both schools for which they were registered for at least one day. Additionally, this indicator only identifies the share of students that change schools for any reasons and not the frequency, number of school switches, or change in residences in a school year. The percentage reflects the last home address available for the student who changed schools. This may or may not be the home address provided for the first school that they are registered to attend.

fields.name: sclsw15
fields.alias: Percent of Students Switching Schools During Year

dictionaries.alias: High School Completion Rate
dictionaries.layerdescription: The percentage of 12th graders in a school year that successfully completed high school out of all 12th graders within an area. Completers are identified as completing their program of study at the high school level and satisfying the graduation requirements for a Maryland High School Diploma or the requirements for a Maryland Certificate of Program Completion.

dictionaries.alias: High School Dropout/Withdrawal Rate
dictionaries.layerdescription: The percentage of 9th through 12th graders who withdraw from public school out of all high school students in a school year. Withdraw codes are used as a proxy for dropping out of school based upon the expectation that withdrawn students are no longer receiving educational services. A dropout is defined as a student who, for any reason other than death, leaves school before graduation or the completion of a Maryland-approved education program and is not known to enroll in another school or State-approved program during a current school year.

dictionaries.alias: Percent of 9th-12th Grade Students that are Chronically Absent
dictionaries.layerdescription: The percentage of 9th-12th grade students that were recognized as being absent from public school 20 or more days out of all students.

fields.name: abshs15
fields.alias: Percent of 9th-12th Graders that are Chronically Absent

dictionaries.alias: Percent of 6th-8th Grade Students that are Chronically Absent
dictionaries.layerdescription: The percentage of 6th-8th grade students that were recognized as being absent from public school 20 or more days out of all students.

fields.name: absmd15
fields.alias: Percent of 6th-8th Graders that are Chronically Absent

dictionaries.alias: Percent of 1st-5th Grade Students that are Chronically Absent
dictionaries.layerdescription: The percentage of 1st-5th grade students that were recognized as being absent from public school 20 or more days out of all students.

fields.name: abse15
fields.alias: Percent of 1st-5th Graders that are Chronically Absent

dictionaries.alias: Percent of Students that are Hispanic
dictionaries.layerdescription: The percentage of students of any grade level who identify their ethnicity as being Hispanic that attend any Baltimore City Public School out of all public school students within an area in a school year.

fields.name: hstud15
fields.alias: Percent of Students that are Hispanic

dictionaries.alias: Percent of Students that are White (non-Hispanic)
dictionaries.layerdescription: The total number of persons that identify themselves as being racially White (and ethnically non-Hispanic) out of the total number of persons living in an area.

fields.name: wstud15
fields.alias: Percent of Students that are White (Non-Hispanic)

dictionaries.alias: Percent of Students that are African American (non-Hispanic)
dictionaries.layerdescription: The percentage of Black/African American students of any grade that attend any Baltimore City Public School out of all public school students within an area in a school year.

fields.name: aastud15
fields.alias: Percent of Students that are African-American

dictionaries.alias: Number of Students Ever Attended 9th - 12th Grade
dictionaries.layerdescription: The number of children who have registered for and attend 9th through 12th grade at a Baltimore City Public School at any point in the school year.

fields.name: hsattend15
fields.alias: Number of Students Ever Attended 9th-12th Grade

dictionaries.alias: Number of Students Ever Attended 6th - 8th Grade
dictionaries.layerdescription: The number of children who have registered for and attend 6th through 8th grade at a Baltimore City Public School at any point in the school year.

fields.name: mattend15
fields.alias: Number of Students Ever Attended 6th-8th Grade

dictionaries.alias: Number of Students Ever Attended 1st - 5th Grade
dictionaries.layerdescription: The number of children who have registered for and attend 1st through 5th grade at a Baltimore City Public School at any point during the school year.

fields.name: eattend15
fields.alias: Number of Students Ever Attended 1st-5th Grade

dictionaries.alias: Teen Birth Rate per 1,000 Females (aged 15-19)
dictionaries.subgroup: Children and Family Health and Well Being
dictionaries.layerdescription: The rate of female teens aged 15-19 that gave birth per 1,000 females aged 15-19.

dictionaries.alias: Liquor Outlet density (per 1,000 Residents)
dictionaries.subgroup: Children and Family Health and Well Being
dictionaries.layerdescription: This indicator reflects the number of business establishments that possess a Class A (Off Sale package goods no on-premises consumption - 6 days, 6:00 a.m.- Midnight. No Sunday sales except Sundays between Thanksgiving Day and New Year's Day upon issuance of a special license for each Sunday) or BD7 (tavern) business license that allows them to sell beer, wine, or liquor. Other liquor licenses to restaurants or on-premise consumption were not included in this analysis. This number is provided by 1,000 residents to allow for comparison across neighborhoods.

dictionaries.alias: Average Healthy Food Availability Index
dictionaries.subgroup: Children and Family Health and Well Being
dictionaries.layerdescription: The Johns Hopkins Center for a Livable Future (CLF) calculated HFAI scores for all food stores in Baltimore, in summer 2012, using an adapted version of the NEMS-S (Nutrition Environment Measures Survey in Stores) tool. The NEMS-S tool was developed by researchers at the Rollins School of Public Health at Emory University to measure the nutritional environment of food retail stores and was designed to assess healthy food availability in grocery and convenience stores. CLF obtained a food permit list from the Baltimore City Health Department in August 2011, which includes all sites that sell food, such as stores, restaurants, and temporary locations such as farmers.

dictionaries.alias: Percent of Children (aged 0-6) with Elevated Blood Lead Levels
dictionaries.subgroup: Children and Family Health and Well Being
dictionaries.layerdescription: The number of children aged 0-6 that are found to either have elevated blood lead levels  (≥10Mg/dL) or lead poisoning (≥20 Mg/dL) out of the number of children tested within an area in a calendar year.

fields.name: ebll15
fields.alias: Percent of Tested Children with Elevated Blood Lead Levels

dictionaries.alias: Life Expectancy
dictionaries.subgroup: Children and Family Health and Well Being
dictionaries.layerdescription: The average number of years a newborn can expect to live, assuming he or she experiences the currently prevailing rates of death through their lifespan.

dictionaries.alias: Infant Mortality
dictionaries.subgroup: Children and Family Health and Well Being
dictionaries.layerdescription: The number of infant deaths (babies under one year of age) per 1,000 live births within the area in a five year period. This is the most stable and commonly measured indicator of mortality in this age group.

dictionaries.alias: Rate of Housing Choice Vouchers per 1,000 Rental Units
dictionaries.layerdescription: The number of rental properties with housing choice vouchers per 1,000 rental properties in an area.

fields.name: hcvhouseXX
fields.alias: Rate of Housing Choice Vouchers per 1,000 Rental Units

dictionaries.alias: Percent Residential Properties that do not Receive Mail
dictionaries.layerdescription: The percentage of residential addresses for which the United States Postal Service has identified as being unoccupied (no mail collection) for a period of at least 90 days or longer. These properties may be habitable, but are not currently being occupied. It is important to note that a single residential property can contain more than one address.

fields.name: nomail15
fields.alias: Percent of Residential Properties that do not Receive Mail

dictionaries.alias: Number of Historic Tax Credits per 1,000 Residential Units
dictionaries.layerdescription: The number of residential properties that received the Historic Tax Credit per 1,000 residential properties within an area. The credit is granted on the increased assessment directly resulting from qualified improvements. The duration of the credit is for 10 years, and is applicable to properties located in designated areas of significant historical value.

fields.name: histax15
fields.alias: Rate of Historic Tax Credits per 1,000 Residential Properties

dictionaries.alias: Affordability Index - Rent
dictionaries.layerdescription: The percentage of households that pay more than 30% of their total household income on rent and related expenses out of all households in an area.

dictionaries.alias: Affordability Index - Mortgage
dictionaries.layerdescription: The percentage of households that pay more than 30% of their total household income on mortgage and other housing-related expenses out of all households in an area.

dictionaries.alias: Number of New Construction Permits per 1,000 Residential Properties
dictionaries.layerdescription: The number of permits issued for new residential buildings per 1,000 existing residential properties within a community. The permits are analyzed by date of issue and not date of completion.

dictionaries.alias: Number of Demolition Permits per 1,000 Residential Properties
dictionaries.layerdescription: The number of permits issued for the demolition of residential buildings per 1,000 existing residential properties. The permits are analyzed by date of issue and not date of actual demolition.

dictionaries.alias: Percentage of Residential Tax Lien Sales
dictionaries.layerdescription: The percentage of residential properties with city liens sold as tax certificates at the annual tax lien certificate sale held in May. Tax sales are used to collect delinquent real property taxes and other unpaid charges to the city, which are liens against the real property. The tax certificate sale is a public online auction of City lien interests on properties that occurs annually in May.

fields.name: taxlien15
fields.alias: Percentage of Residential Tax Lien Sales

dictionaries.alias: Precentage of Residential Sales in Foreclosure (REO)
dictionaries.layerdescription: The percentage of properties where the lending company or loan servicer has filed a foreclosure proceeding with the Baltimore City Circuit Court out of all residential properties within an area. This is not a measure of actual foreclosures since not every property that receives a filing results in a property dispossession.

fields.name: reosa15
fields.alias: Percent of Residential Sales in Foreclosure (REO)

dictionaries.alias: Percentage of Residential Sales for Cash
dictionaries.layerdescription: The portion of homes and condominiums sold for cash out of all residential properties sold in a calendar year. These types of sales tend to signify investor-based purchases as homes purchased for cash either become rental properties or later sold again in an effort to generate a profit.

fields.name: cashsa15
fields.alias: Percent of Residential Sales for Cash

dictionaries.alias: Percentage of Properties with Rehabilitation Permits Exceeding $5,000
dictionaries.layerdescription: The portion of residential properties that have applied for and received a permit to renovate the interior and/or exterior of a property where the cost of renovation will exceed $5,000. The threshold of $5,000 is used to differentiate a minor and more significant renovation project.

fields.name: resrehab15
fields.alias: Percent of Residential Properties with Rehab Permits Over $5,000

dictionaries.alias: Percentage of Residential Properties that are Vacant and Abandoned
dictionaries.layerdescription: The percentage of residential properties that have been classified as being vacant and abandoned by the Baltimore City Department of Housing out of all properties. Properties are classified as being vacant and abandoned if: the property is not habitable and appears boarded up or open to the elements; the property was designated as being vacant prior to the current year and still remains vacant; and the property is a multi-family structure where all units are considered to be vacant.

fields.name: vacant15
fields.alias: Percent of Residential Properties that are Vacant and Abandoned

dictionaries.alias: Percentage of Residential Properties Under Mortgage Foreclosure
dictionaries.layerdescription: The percentage of properties where the lending company or loan servicer has filed a foreclosure proceeding with the Baltimore City Circuit Court out of all residential properties within an area. This is not a measure of actual foreclosures since not every property that receives a filing results in a property dispossession.

fields.name: fore15
fields.alias: Percent of Properties Under Mortgage Foreclosure

dictionaries.alias: Percentage of Housing Units that are Owner-Occupied
dictionaries.layerdescription: The percentage of homeowners that are the principal residents of a particular residential property out of all residential properties. It is important to note that a portion of these owner-occupied properties may be subdivided and have tenants that pay rent and are not included in the calculation.

fields.name: ownroc15
fields.alias: Percentage of Properties that are Owner-Occupied

dictionaries.alias: Number of Homes Sold
dictionaries.layerdescription: The portion of the homes and condominiums sold that were identified as being owned by the bank (REO) out of all residential properties sold in a calendar year.

dictionaries.alias: Median Number of Days on the Market
dictionaries.layerdescription: The median number of days that homes listed for sale sits on the public market in a given area. This time period is from the date it is listed for sale till the day the contract of sale is signed. Private (non-listed) home sale transactions are not included in this indicator. The median days on market is used as opposed to the average so that both extremely high and extremely low days on the market do not distort the length of time for which homes are listed on the market.

fields.name: dom15
fields.alias: Median Number of Days on the Market

dictionaries.alias: Median Price of Homes Sold
dictionaries.layerdescription: The median home sales price is the middle value of the prices for which homes are sold (both market and private transactions) within a calendar year. The median value is used as opposed to the average so that both extremely high and extremely low prices do not distort the prices for which homes are sold. This measure does not take into account the assessed value of a property.

dictionaries.alias: Rate of Dirty Streets and Alleys Reports per 1,000 Residents
dictionaries.layerdescription: The rate of service requests for dirty streets and alleys through Baltimore's CitiStat 311 system.

fields.name: dirtyst15
fields.alias: Rate of 311 Calls for Service for Dirty Streets and Alleys

dictionaries.alias: Rate of Clogged Storm Drain Reports per 1,000 Residents
dictionaries.layerdescription: The rate of service requests for addressing clogged storm drains made through Baltimore's CitiStat 311 system.

fields.name: clogged15
fields.alias: Rate of 311 Calls for Service for Clogged Storm Drains

dictionaries.alias: Percent of Population that Uses Public Transportation to Get to Work
dictionaries.layerdescription: The percentage of commuters that use public transit out of all commuters aged 16 and above.

fields.name: pubtran15
fields.alias: Percent of the Population that Uses Public Transportation to Work

dictionaries.alias: Percent of Population that Walks to Work
dictionaries.layerdescription: The percentage of commuters that walk to work out of all commuters aged 16 and above.

fields.name: walked15
fields.alias: Percent of the Population that Walks to Work

dictionaries.alias: Percent of Employed Population with Travel Time to Work of 0-14 Minutes
dictionaries.layerdescription: The percentage of commuters that spend less than 15 minutes commuting to work out of all commuters aged 16 and above.

fields.name: trav14_15
fields.alias: Percent of the Employed Population with a Travel Time to Work of 0-14 Minutes

dictionaries.alias: Percent of Employed Population with Travel Time to Work of 15-29 Minutes
dictionaries.layerdescription: The percentage of commuters that spend between 15 and 29 minutes commuting to work out of all commuters aged 16 and above.

fields.name: trav29_15
fields.alias: Percent of the Employed Population with a Travel Time to Work of 15-29 Minutes

dictionaries.alias: Percent of Employed Population with Travel Time to Work of 30-44 Minutes
dictionaries.layerdescription: The percentage of commuters that spend between 30 and 44 minutes travelling to work out of all commuters aged 16 and above.

fields.name: trav44_15
fields.alias: Percent of the Employed Population with a Travel Time to Work of 30-44 Minutes

dictionaries.alias: Percent of Employed Population with Travel Time to Work of 45 Minutes and Over
dictionaries.layerdescription: The percentage of commuters that spend more than 45 minutes travelling to work out of all commuters aged 16 and above.

fields.name: trav45_15
fields.alias: Percent of the Employed Population with a Travel Time to Work of 45+ Minutes

dictionaries.alias: Number of Community Managed Open Spaces
dictionaries.layerdescription: The number of community managed open spaces in an area that include community gardens (food-producing or ornamental), Adopt-A-Lots, or some other green space managed by the community.

fields.name: cmos15
fields.alias: Number of Community Managed Open Spaces

dictionaries.alias: Percent of Households with No Vehicles Available
dictionaries.layerdescription: The percentage of households that do not have a personal vehicle available for use out of all households in an area.

fields.name: novhcl15
fields.alias: Percent of Households with No Vehicles Available

dictionaries.alias: Percent of Residential Properties Weatherized
dictionaries.layerdescription: The percent of residential properties that were eligible for and received weatherization assistance such as air sealing or furnace replacements. The Weatherization Assistance Program helps eligible low-income households lower their energy costs by increasing the energy efficiency of their homes, while ensuring their health and safety.

dictionaries.alias: Number of Trees of Planted
dictionaries.layerdescription: Total number of trees planed in a given area.

dictionaries.alias: Total Number of Businesses
dictionaries.layerdescription: The total number of businesses (both for-profit and non-profit) within an area at a single time in a year.

dictionaries.alias: Percent of Commercial Properties with Rehab Permits Above $5,000
dictionaries.layerdescription: The percentage of properties that are investing within their current establishment and not the level of their investment. Permits for work below $5,000 are considered to be minor and not included in this indicator. A single establishment can apply for and receive multiple permits.

fields.name: crehab15
fields.alias: Percent of Commercial Properties with Rehabilitation Permits Over $5,000

dictionaries.alias: Total Number of Commercial Properties
dictionaries.layerdescription: The total number of commerically zoned properties in a given area.

dictionaries.alias: Percent  Population (25 years and over) with a Bachelor's Degree or Above
dictionaries.layerdescription: The percentage of persons that have completed, graduated, or received a Bachelor's degree or higher, including Master's degree, Ph.D, J.D., or any other terminal degree.

fields.name: bahigher15
fields.alias: Percent of Population 25+ with a Bachelor's Degree or Above

dictionaries.alias: Percent  Population (25 years and over) With High School Diploma and Some College or Associates Degree
dictionaries.layerdescription: The percentage of persons that have completed, graduated, or received a high school diploma or GED and also has taken some college courses or completed their Associate's degree. This is a standard indicator used to measure the portion of the population with a basic level of skills needed for the workplace. Persons under the age of 25 are not included in this analysis since many of these persons are still attending various levels of schooling.

fields.name: hsdipl15
fields.alias: Percent of the Population 25+ with a High School Diploma and Some College or Associates Degree

dictionaries.alias: Percent  Population (25 years and over) With Less Than a High School Diploma or GED
dictionaries.layerdescription: The percentage of persons that have not completed, graduated, or received a high school diploma or GED. This is a standard indicator used to measure the portion of the population with less than a basic level of skills needed for the workplace. Persons under the age of 25 are not included in this analysis since many of these persons are still attending various levels of schooling.

fields.name: lesshs15
fields.alias: Percent of the Population 25+ With Less than a High School Diploma/GED

dictionaries.alias: Unemployment Rate
dictionaries.layerdescription: The number of persons between the ages of 16 and 64 that are in the labor force (and are looking for work) but are not currently working.

dictionaries.alias: Percent  Population 16-64 Not in Labor Force
dictionaries.layerdescription: The number of persons who are not in the labor force out of all persons between the ages of 16 and 64 in the area. There are several reasons why persons may not be included in the labor force. These reasons may include: they are caretakers for children or other family members; they attend school or job training; they may have a disability; and they are discouraged or frustrated and have given up seeking a job or have a history that may include criminal activity.

fields.name: nilf15
fields.alias: Percent of Population 16-64 Not in the Labor Force

dictionaries.alias: Percent  Population 16-64 Unemployed and Looking for Work

fields.name: unempl15
fields.alias: Percent of Population 16-64 Unemployed and Looking for Work

dictionaries.alias: Percent  Population 16-64 Employed
dictionaries.layerdescription: The number of persons between the ages of 16 and 64 formally employed or self-employed and earning a formal income. It is used to understand how many persons are working out of the entire population, not just those in the labor force (persons who may be looking for work or working).

dictionaries.alias: Community Statistical Areas
dictionaries.layerdescription: Community Statistical Areas for Baltimore City.

dictionaries.alias: Neighborhoods
Zip Codes
dictionaries.layerdescription: This dataset is the 2011 Maryland zip codes based on 2011 Md PropertyView data.

dictionaries.alias: Watersheds
